result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Christopher W. Cousins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher W. Cousins is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher W. Cousins was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Christopher W. Cousins was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Refrain from conduct which constitutes a violation of the criminal laws of any state of the United States or ordinances substantially conforming to a criminal statute.
Remain subject to terms and conditions of bond.
Successfully complete all terms and conditions of 12 month probation
Notify Clerk of Court and District Attorney's office in writing within 72 hours of any change of address. Any letters or notices sent by District Attorney or Clerk of Court sent to defendant's last known address which are returned unclaimed or which otherwise indicate that the defendant no longer resides there will result in revocation of DPA and issuance of warrant for arrest.

Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

11:40 a.m. Defendant Christopher W. Cousins in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Christopher W. Cousins in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf234, 15cf259, 16cf31. Attorney Burns has not been appointed - defendant notified of revocation - Burns not in receipt of revocation summary. Off record for discussion with client - 11:42 a.m. 
11:43 a.m. - On record - Burns statement that defendant wishes to proceed pro se - waiver free and voluntary - Defendant in receipt of revocation packet. Schiek/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence - all CC

Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 17, 2017 at 10:30 am.

2:19 pm Defendant Christopher W. Cousins in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Christopher W. Cousins in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf31 and 16cv34. Schiek states resolution - Burns clarifies agreement. Plea questionnaire filed. State moves to amend Counts 2 and 3 to a violation of 961.41(3g)(e) - Misdemeanor possession of THC - Granted. State moves to dismiss Counts 4 and 5 - Granted. Defendant enters guilty plea to Counts 1, 2 and 3.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 and 3. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists, accepts plea, defers entry of judgment and accepts written DEJ agreement as to Count 1. Schiek/Burns/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court sentence-Counts 2 and 3 
WHS/POP - 12 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO. 
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Bail continued.

In 16cv34 - State moves for judgment of forfeiture - Granted. DA's office to prepare Order. 

Burns statement that defendant is being held in ONSO on fail to pay warrants - moves for Court to allow another payment plan for all fines and to be released from jail on fail to pay warrants - Court address unpaid fines - Defendant states the most he can pay for fines is $50 monthly. Court orders $100 monthly payment beginning September 1, 2016; court costs in 16cf31 to be added to payment plan. Court explains if Defendant misses payment on payment plan - warrants will be issued. Any warrants are quashed - no credit for time served on fail to pay. Defendant may be released from ONSO. 
Adj. 2:46 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for July 24, 2017 at 03:30 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
